export_format.description: The vendor states the EHI export produces C-CDA XML files (USCDI v1 compliant) for single patient or patient population, and also supports FHIR R4 Bulk Data export. No detail on packaging/container format is provided. The export re-uses standardized formats rather than dumping raw database content.

clinical.evidence: C-CDA export includes clinical data per USCDI v1 (problems, medications, allergies, procedures, etc.)

secure_messages.evidence: Not mentioned in documentation. C-CDA and FHIR Bulk Data do not typically include portal messages.

billing_financial.evidence: Not mentioned in documentation. C-CDA does not include billing data. No mention of charges, claims, or payments.

insurance_coverage.evidence: Not mentioned in documentation. While FHIR R4 has Coverage resources, no specific mention of insurance data in EHI export.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: Not mentioned in documentation. C-CDA encounters may capture visit history but not scheduling data.

documents_images.evidence: Not specifically mentioned. C-CDA can embed documents but no explicit statement about document/image export.

audit_trails.evidence: Not mentioned in documentation. Neither C-CDA nor FHIR Bulk Data typically includes audit trail data.

issues: Documentation is extremely minimal — 3-page PDF with only a few paragraphs of substantive content
No data dictionary or field-level documentation provided
No description of what specific data domains are included in the export beyond 'C-CDA' and 'FHIR'
Export appears to be C-CDA + FHIR Bulk Data rather than a raw database dump — likely missing billing, insurance, messages, audit trails, and other non-clinical data
Document states it is 'intended for use of iPatientCare clients only' despite being publicly accessible
Last updated February 2023 — may be outdated
No mention of how much data beyond USCDI v1 / US Core STU 3.1.1 is included — likely not 'all EHI' as required by b(10)
summary: AssureCare LLC provides a minimal 3-page PDF documenting their EHI export for iPatientCare. The export uses C-CDA XML and FHIR R4 Bulk Data formats, which are standardized clinical data formats rather than raw database exports. No data dictionary, field-level detail, or explicit coverage of non-clinical data (billing, insurance, messages, audit trails) is documented, raising questions about whether the export truly captures 'all EHI' as required by 170.315(b)(10).
